intro: Pentanisia, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Montiaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with succulent leaves and are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. They often grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. The flowers are usually small and clustered, often with five petals, giving the genus its scientific name. Pentanisia species are of interest in botanical studies due to their unique adaptations to harsh environments.
